definition: student of a senior high school
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: A high school student walking with her father, who is holding her bag.
sentences.chinese: 一名高中学生与她的父亲，父亲帮她拿着书包。

sentences.english: As is mentioned above, the number of the students in senior high school is increasing.
sentences.chinese: 如上面提到的那样，高中学生的人数正越来越多。

sentences.english: We asked high school students to particpate in an anti-drug campaign.
sentences.chinese: 我们要求高中学生全程在禁毒专项斗争。

sentences.english: The paper analyzes how to improve senior middle school students' music appreciation ability.
sentences.chinese: 现就如何提高高中学生的音乐鉴赏能力进行简要分析。

sentences.english: High-school students in Japan 'receive about half the science instruction their British counterparts get.
sentences.chinese: 日本高中学生所受的理科教育大约是英国学生的一半。

sentences.english: Students learn in high school that their introduction should begin with something general.
sentences.chinese: 高中学生学习过第一段的介绍应该是概括性的。

sentences.english: For a group of high school students from Davy, Florida.
sentences.chinese: 而对于一群佛罗里达戴维高中学生而言。

sentences.english: In the United States, high school students can choose  what classes they want to take.
sentences.chinese: 在美国，高中学生可以自己选择喜欢的课程。

sentences.english: A high school student dies after 30-hour computer gaming binge.
sentences.chinese: 在放纵玩电脑游戏30小时之后，一个高中学生死了。

sentences.english: It's required for every high school students to preview the lessons before class.
sentences.chinese: 课前预习功课是每位高中学生必须做的。

definition: to pass brilliantly (used in congratulatory fashion)
senior high school/abbr. for 高級中學|高级中学[gao1 ji2 zhong1 xue2]
junior high school/abbr. for 初級中學|初级中学[chu1 ji2 zhong1 xue2]
teacher in charge of a class
excelling both in morals and studies (idiom); top marks for studies and for behavior (at school)/a paragon of virtue and learning
student who repeats (a course, grade etc) at school
